title: Arinell Pizza
description: Famous for their New York style thin crust pizza, Arinell's is the perfect place to satisy your unrelenting hunger without breaking the bank. Don't forget to bring cash, as these guys don't take credit (to keep their prices low).

cathash.Quick But Good: Grab a slice of New York style pizza
cathash.Study Snacks: Eat delicious cheap pizza and cram

title: Nefeli Cafe
description: The quiet atmosphere and delicious coffees of Nefeli's is conducive to focused studying sessions. Be sure to try our their Chai Latte (we swear they put crack in it) and get a side order of their food if you're hungry.
categories: Brunch Time is All the Time

cathash.Study Snacks: Eat Greek and Mediterranean food in the quiet Nefeli Cafe
cathash.Study with some background noise: Sip a Chai Latte in the quiet Nefeli Cafe
cathash.Brunch Time is All the Time: Chow down Greek and Mediterranean grub at Nefeli Cafe

title: Upper/Lower Fire Trails/Panoramic Way/Panoramic Hill
description: Experience the gorgeous sunset that scatters its final rays across the East Bay and San Francisco. Try to make it up on a clear day, as fog is a common nuisance obstructing the view. The trails are wide enough to safely walk on after dark, but be sure to carry a flashlight (or download one) to ensure you don't step on a raccoon or something.

cathash.Take a hike: Hike the Upper/Lower Fire Trails with an unbeatable view
cathash.Scenic Views: Watch an epic sunset at Panoramic Hill

title: Tilden Park
description: Lovely park nestled in the hills that features an endless number of hiking trails and stunning views. Try to come on a clear day as the fog will obscure the view. If you're in a cuddly mood after your hike, they also have a petting zoo that you can visit. It's worth noting that beautiful hikes and cute animals are a great cure for a hangover.

cathash.Walk it out: Walk through Tilden Park's stunning views
cathash.Take a hike: Hike through Tilden Park's stunning views
cathash.Scenic Views: Bask in the stunning views of the Bay at Tilden Park

title: Lake Anza
description: Want to get wet? Make your way to Lake Anza (with a partner or group) and be beach bums for the day. There's a small fee to get in (about $6) and they also have a concession stand if you're hungry/thirsty. They also have showers where you can wash off sand, lake weeds, bird poo, etc.

cathash.Get wet: Go swimming and lay out at the beach of Lake Anza

title: People's Park
description: Whether you want to have a candle lit picnic with that special someone or you're in the mood for a pickup game of basketball, People's Park has accommodations for all sorts of folks. Homeless people tend to sleep here at night, so try to leave within an hour of sunset.

cathash.Hangout spots: Have a picnic at People's Park
cathash.Sports: Play basketball, football, or soccer at People's Park

title: Berkeley Marina
description: The Marina has something to offer for everyone: long walks, great views, biking trails, fishing, and laying out in the sun. It's also a great place to take a date - it's free, yet your partner will think it's 'romantic'. Score for your wallet.

cathash.Walk it out: Take a walk along the Berkeley Marina
cathash.Get wet: Go fishing or sailing at the Berkeley Marina
cathash.Scenic Views: Enjoy the water scenery of the Berkeley Marina
cathash.Hangout spots: Spend some time hanging around the Berkeley Marina

title: Barney's Gourmet Hamburgers
description: After retiring his purple dinosaur suit, Barney decided to open up a delicious burger shop over on Shattuck Ave. The Sunshine Burger is a popular choice here and be sure to get a side of sweet potato fries. If you're lactose tolerant, the Turkish Coffee Milkshake is delightful.

cathash.Sit Down... Stay A While: Try a gourmet burger with curly fries at Barney's
cathash.Quick But Good: Sit down for a delicious burger with curly fries at Barney's

title: Fentons Creamery
description: Featured in Disney's movie "Up", Fentons has been a hit for over 115 years. It still has the classic 50's diner feel and taste. Sundaes, toasted almond ice cream and Black and Tan ice cream are must haves for first timers. They also have an ice cream challenge for those brave enough to tempt diabetes.

cathash.Sweet Tooth: Scream for some ice cream at the world famous Fenton Creamery

title: Ici
description: Satisfy your sweet tooth while trying out wacky new ice cream flavors like their famous "Earl Grey", "Creme Fraiche Hazelnut Crunch", "Malted vanilla-sour Cherry" and more. It's all organic, the cones are made on site and the result is an explosion of awesome in your mouth.

cathash.Ice Cream: Snag a unique scoop or two at Ici Ice Cream

title: Tara's Organic Ice Cream
description: Tara's features ice cream flavors that are inspired by the Middle East/Asia. Black Sesame, white pepper chocolate chip, Mayan chocolate and sweet corn are a few of the most popular flavors.

cathash.Ice Cream: Try some exotic organic ice cream at Tara's

title: BurgerMeister
description: If you don't like award winning orgranic burgers, roasted garlic curly fries or great service, stay the hell away from BurgerMeister. Otherwise, grab your friends, head there right now and enjoy the casual atmosphere and chill waiters and waitresses.

cathash.Sit Down... Stay A While: Sink your teeth into organic burgers and roasted garlic curry fries at BurgerMeister

title: Bongo Burger
description: Soft juicy meat, freshly shredded lettuce, and crinkle cut fries make for one of the best burger experiences in Berkeley. If you miss one thing after graduating, it'll probably be the countless times you'll have spent wolfing down food at Bongo Burger.

cathash.Quick But Good: Treat yourself to a gamechanger Bongo Burger (Euclid Ave)

title: Bongo Burger
description: Soft juicy meat, freshly shredded lettuce, and crinkle cut fries make for one of the best burger experiences in Berkeley. If you miss one thing after graduating, it'll probably be the countless times you'll have spent wolfing down food at Bongo Burger.

cathash.Quick But Good: Treat yourself to a gamechanger Bongo Burger (Center St)

title: Bongo Burger
description: Soft juicy meat, freshly shredded lettuce, and crinkle cut fries make for one of the best burger experiences in Berkeley. If you miss one thing after graduating, it'll probably be the countless times you'll have spent wolfing down food at Bongo Burger.

cathash.Quick But Good: Treat yourself to a gamechanger Bongo Burger (Dwight Way)

title: Cheese Board Pizza
description: Made on thin sourdough crust, Cheese Board has an array of fresh ingredients and unusual cheeses to top your pizza with. They also make one type of vegetarian pizza each night, for vegetarians who like to live on the wild side.

cathash.Quick But Good: Feast on a slice and enjoy live music at the Cheese Board Collective

title: CREAM
description: Imagine your favorite gourmet ice cream flavor smushed between two of your favorite cookies. And those cookies just came out of the oven. This is what's waiting for you at CREAM (short for 'Cookies Rule Everything Around Me', not kidding).

cathash.Sweet Tooth: Wolf down an earthshaking ice cream sandwich at CREAM

title: Grizzly Peak
description: Hike, bike, walk or drive to the top of Grizzly Peak and enjoy the stunning view of the entire valley. There are also a number of trails that go off from the road and into the hills. Watch the sunset with your bros and/or gals for a relaxing evening.

cathash.Walk it out: Take a scenic walk on the trails at Grizzly Peak
cathash.Take a hike: Hike up to the top of Grizzly Peak for a stunning view
cathash.Scenic Views: Catch sunset or a view of the entire valley at Grizzley Peak
cathash.Hangout spots: Kick back and relax with a breathtaking view of the valley at Grizzly Peak

title: Sliver
description: Pizza fanatics go nuts over Sliver. They have a unique "green sauce" that is 'the bomb'. Live music plays during dinner every day except for Monday, and happy hour is 4-7pm Monday - Saturday.

cathash.Quick But Good: Grab a slice and a brew at the Sliver pizzeria

title: Purple Kow
description: Arguably the best boba joint in Berkeley. The boba here is soft, chewy and has a hint of sweet - it's magnificent. The iced milk and grass jelly are also huge hits at Purple Kow.

cathash.Sweet Tooth: Chow down on some boba (or find out how good it is) at Purple Kow

title: Angeline's Louisiana Kitchen
description: Step aside, impostor southern cooking joints. Angeline's Louisiana Kitchen is taking this whole scene over. They have knuckle sucking ribs, fried chicken, and other delectable southern style dishes.

cathash.Sit Down... Stay A While: Chow down on some southern-style cooking at Angeline's Louisiana Kitchen

title: Musashi Japanese Restaurant
description: Family owned authentic Japanese restaurant. Big ticket item: weekly $6.50 specials before 7pm. Includes all the elementsfresh, tasty food, a mix of traditional and unique dishes, friendly service, tasteful decor, good prices, happy hour, an excellent sake selection, and best of all, within walking distance of campus. What isn't there to love? Happy Hour is Tues-Fri 5:30-7pm

cathash.Feeling Adventurous: Dig into some inspired authentic Japanese dishes at Musashi

title: Guerilla Cafe
description: Art, coffee, and vibes. If you're looking for a hole in the wall feel, this is the place. The food will not disappoint, and they offer Blue Bottle coffee matter-of-factly served, without the ultrahip attitude of the SF venues or Philz down the block. The place is tiny with only a few tables for parties of four (most others are for parties of two or bar seating), so it can get pretty crowded at peak times (11-1 on a weekend).
categories: Brunch Time is All the Time

cathash.Brunch Time is All the Time: Head to one of the premiere brunch spots on campus at the Guerilla Cafe
cathash.Study with some background noise: Study up with a cup of Blue Bottle at Guerilla Cafe
cathash.Study Snacks: Study up with a cup of Blue Bottle at Guerilla Cafe

title: Indian Rock Park
description: Indian Rock Park is a well-known Berkeley favorite. It is particularly popular for its view of the sun setting over the San Francisco Bay. You haven't seen all of Berkeley if you haven't seen Indian Rock Park! Indian Rock is the largest of the rock outcroppings in the Berkeley Hills, situated along the west side of Indian Rock Avenue. On the east side of Indian Rock Avenue, you will find smaller rock outcroppings, a shaded grassy area, and a barbeque and picnic area.
address: 950 Indian Rock Avenue at Shattuck Avenue

cathash.Hangout spots: Kick back on top of Indian Rock
cathash.Scenic Views: Check out the sunset over the bay from Indian Rock

title: Boot and Shoe Service
description: Located in an old brick-and-timber hardware store, this revered Telegraph Avenue hotspot employs organic and sustainably farmed ingredients in thin-crusted, wood-fired pizzas topped with sorrel, rapini, green garlic, guanciale and other ingredients not usually encountered at your local Round Table. There are usually eight kinds of pizza available on a given night. All begin with a wonderfully light, tender crust you can observe in the act of creation as the chef stands in the open kitchen beside the glowing oven, kneading and massaging and letting the dough's weight stretch itself into the proper consistency.

cathash.Sit Down... Stay A While: Sit back and enjoy a slice of sinfully good Boot and Shoe Service pizza

title: Bowl'd
description: The menu at Bowl'd is in English and features snapshots of many dishes. The waiters are articulate and unswervingly patient, and the dining room's jade decor, with its long banquettes and glossy wood tables, is inviting. Kids' rice bowls ($6), gentle Brazilian music and a range of Korean beverages, including a sparkling yet creamy rice wine ($12 per bottle), create a homey spirit. It's impossible to not be seduced by the build-your-own rice bowls ($12), a captivating mix of textures and tastes: cool vegetables and grains, creamy egg and warm rice. Flavors start mild, but sides of homemade chile paste and citrusy soy lend unlimited punch.

cathash.Sit Down... Stay A While: Gear up for some killer Korean cuisine at Bowl'd

title: Al's Big Burger
description: Is your brain perforated with the daily stresses of a mundane yet painful semi-urban, modern existence? Are the requirements of thinking about food too difficult to comprehend, leading you to the conundrum of malnourishment vs. gorging on something unhealthy yet simple? The burgers there are hot, flavorful, and pretty juicy. The fries are dangerously hot, very delicious salt conductors, and pretty damn unhealthy. We eat here. We are happy. It's cheap, full of love, and the place to go when you need some easy. Man, we need that a lot.

cathash.Quick But Good: Sink your teeth into a good o'l fashioned greasebomb at Al's Big Burger

title: Yoshi's Oakland
description: Yoshi's Oakland not only showcases the world's best jazz, gospel, world music and other entertainment, but its acclaimed chef Shotaro "Sho" Kamio is famed for creating some of the finest modern Japanese cuisine in the area. The live music club and upscale restaurant has been located in Jack London Square since 1997 and offers an unmatched entertainment experience. The venue has hosted such legendary jazz greats as Betty Carter, Max Roach, Dizzy Gillespie, Joe Williams, Diana Krall, Branford Marsalis, McCoy Tyner, Harry Connick Jr., Oscar Peterson and hundreds of others, including name comedians.

cathash.Feeling Adventurous: Gear up for an evening of fine Japanese cuisine and classy live entertainment
cathash.Sit Down... Stay A While: Class it up with some fine modern Japanese cuisine and live music

title: Pyramid Alehouse
description: The beers brewed here are absolutely delectable, especially the Apricot Ale. If you want to try all of their best flavors, the beer sampler won't disappoint. They also have tours of the brewery every day at 4pm. Happy hour 3:30-6:30pm with $3.50 pints and $3-6 food. Daily specials like 'kill the keg Monday'.

cathash.Berkeley Favorites: Grab a brew or twelve at the Pyramid Alehouse
cathash.Sit Down... Stay A While: Sink your teeth into a burger and some craft beer at the Pyramid Alehouse restaurant

title: Lake Merritt
description: Just east of downtown, Lake Merritt (technicahlly a salt AND freshwater lake) is a focal point of Oakland. The lake features grassy shores; several artificial islands intended as bird refuges; an interpretive center called the Rotary Nature Center; a boating center where sailboats, canoes and rowboats can be rented and classes are held; and a fairy tale themed amusement park called Children's Fairyland. A popular 3.1 mile walking and jogging path runs along its perimeter, as well as the famous "necklace of lights".

cathash.Walk it out: Take a stroll along the scenic perimeter of Lake Merritt
cathash.Get wet: Rent a boat or go for a swim in Lake Merritt
cathash.Hangout spots: Kick back and relax on the shore of Lake Merritt

title: Champa Garden
description: Sometimes, a hole-in-the wall is exactly what you want, especially with terrific service, generous portions, and slam-dunk dishes. This place can get pretty slammed during lunch hours, but you'll never wait more than 20 minutes. Fried rice ball salad and pad see ew are two of their more popular dishes.

cathash.Feeling Adventurous: Treat yourself to a fried rice ball salad at Laotian cuisine at Champa Garden

title: Cock-A-Doodle Cafe
description: Packed with hipsters and a diverse crowd that feels hella Oakland, Sunday brunch here is a party. No wonder: Blanca Arechiga’s Victorian-storefront cafe serves up some of the city’s brightest-tasting morning food — like ceviche Benedict, with its roasted pepper-coconut sauce and sparkly hash of shrimp, tilapia, and mango. Lemon ricotta pancakes are dense and custardy, while graham-cracker-crusted French toast is sponge-cake light. Stick with the a.m., though; the weekday lunch chow is on the clunky side.
categories: Brunch Time is All the Time

cathash.Brunch Time is All the Time: Dig into some Cuban specialties at one of the most popular brunch spots in Oakland, Cock-A-Doodle Cafe

title: Chop Bar
description: Cool, funky industrial vibe + friendly waitstaff + delicious gastronomic offerings. Breakfast is served until 11 AM - so good. Great for lunch, dinner or just coffee. What seemed like a fad just a few short years ago has now become a fixture of the local dining landscape. Oakland’s Chop Bar was One of the first local restaurants to explore the notion of kegged wine.
categories: Brunch Time is All the Time

cathash.Brunch Time is All the Time: Brunch it up at a the Jack London Square staple Chop Bar
cathash.Sit Down... Stay A While: Enjoy a burger and some oxtail poutine at Chop Bar
cathash.Berkeley Favorites: Guzzle down some kegged Wine at Chop Bar

title: Shan Dong Restaurant
description: You know this place is good since it's always packed, but the food is well worth the wait. If you're looking for a place to eat authentic Chinese handmade noodles and dumplings, Shan Dong will not let you down. Thick skinned dumplings- crazy good. Hard to walk away without cleaning the plates.

cathash.Quick But Good: Devour some divine dumplings at Shan Dong

title: Noodle Theory
description: Louis Kao’s handsome little noodle shop is an appealing stir-fry of the vivid and the simple. Good-quality meats and poultry — in most cases grilled to a blackened deliciousness — get most of the focus atop basic bowls of soupy ramen or wok-tossed noodles. Grilled chicken over ginger noodles is a home-style dish you could dip your chopsticks into once a week, while grilled beef udon in curry broth is lush and satisfying. Noodles can be a tad overcooked, but you’ll happily slurp everything around them.

cathash.Sit Down... Stay A While: Indulge in some Asian noodles at Noodle Theory

title: Homeroom
description: The best Mac n Cheese you can buy in the Bay Area. To get the full creamy, decadent, comfort food experience requires devoting about 1500 of your daily calories to the meal, but it is so worth it. The staff is super friendly, is happy to lend advice, and some of their creations on the secret menu are better than the listed items.

cathash.Sit Down... Stay A While: Enjoy some mind-blowing mac and cheese at Homeroom

title: Kona Club
description: One of the Easy Bay's favorite bars. The bartenders are always super friendly and the people here are generally not as scary as you would think they'd be for Oakland. Sister establishment to Thalassa in Berkeley, for anyone who's a fan of the pool hall.

cathash.Hang out: Enjoy tiki drinks and hula girls at Kona Club

title: Conga Lounge
description: This place is a great little retreat after school or work. It's small, but cute and fun. Great decor, and they always have old VHS surfer movies playing at the bar. Also you can order anything off the menu from pizza rustica downstairs.

cathash.Hang out: Watch surfer movies at Conga Lounge
cathash.Sit Down... Stay A While: Eat, drink and watch surfer movies at Conga Lounge

title: Cinnaholic
description: One of the best cinnamon rolls you'll ever eat. Their cinnamon rolls are fluffy, soft, and sweet. Their rolls are indeed vegan and for all the skeptics out there that believe vegan food can't taste as good, this place will prove you wrong. Plus it's gluten free, dairy and lactose free and cholesterol free so almost everyone can enjoy one.

cathash.Sweet Tooth: Grab a decadant cinnamon roll at Cinnaholic
cathash.Study Snacks: Take a break and eat a cinnamon roll at Cinnaholic

title: Cal Sailing Club
description: The best community of sailors in the Bay Area. Great parties, amazing Bay Area cruises, and large fleet to choose from.

cathash.Get Wet: Take a boat out at the Cal Sailing Club

title: University of California Botanical Garden at Berkeley
description: Probably the best botanical garden in the East Bay - it is well worth your time to visit.  The Botanical Garden is a truly magical place. There are collections of plants from almost every continent.

title: Cragmont Park
description: his small park has a basketball court, a covered patio with nice views of the bay and Albany/El Cerrito, a lawn, and a porta-poty. But, the real star of this park is the vertical rock face that is great for top-rope climbing. There are a few bolts at the top, so minimal equipment is needed to get set up. Do be careful, though, as the rocks can get slippery up here.

cathash.Sports: Climb some rocks at Cragmont Park
cathash.Scenic Views: Take a gander of the bay at Cragmont Park

title: Remillard Park
description: Great beginner's climbing. There's a 5.2 free solo up a chimney to get on top of the main rock, followed by a quick & easy repel off. Bring some slings! You'll need them to anchor in.

cathash.Hangout spots: Chill on the green at Remillard Park

title: Slow
description: Fine food - items not seen elsewhere, interior seating for about 20 people, takes orders 'to go' and 'for here.' More than one dollar sign though, average meal is 15 to 18 dollars.

cathash.Feeling Adventurous: Relish unique gormet dishes made using local ingredients at Slow

title: Company Restaurant
description: Located in SF, Company has really hit its stride; the food is consistently excellently executed and is showing more of a creative flair.  The menu is largely California- Mediterranean style but there are occasional Asian accents (the Vietnamese pork belly was very tasty and not too fatty). The wine list is well-selected and the wines on tap provide some excellent value by the glass, half-carafe and carafe.

cathash.Feeling Adventurous: Savor some Cali-Mediterranean-Asian fusion at Company

title: Alexander's Steakhouse
description: Feeling fancy and found a $50 bill on the ground? Alexander's has some of the best steaks, prime ribs, and more in the Bay Area.

cathash.Sit Down... Stay A While: Revel in the best steaks around at Alexander's Steakhouse
cathash.Feeling Adventurous: Revel in the best steaks around at Alexander's Steakhouse

title: Takara Sake
description: For just 5$ you can taste 8 different sakes ranging from sweet, filtered, unfiltered, and warm sake, along with a self-guided tour of their museum on how traditional 19th century Japanese sake is distilled. It includes an exhibit of the historical sake-making process, sake artifacts and implements collected by Takara, and a history of sake-making in America.

cathash.Specialty drinks: Try an array of different sakes at Takara Sake
cathash.Museum: Learn about the artisanal distilling of sake at the Takara Sake museum

title: McNally Irish Pub
description: McNallys is the jam. Great spot, never too crowded. Guinness is the appropriate temperature. It's nice and murky, like a proper pub, and there's a fireplace for winter time (nothing finer than sippin a pint next to a cozy fire). It's also a healthy walk from rockridge BART. And it's quite close to the library if you are a day drinker that enjoys literature.

cathash.Hang out: Sit around the fireplace at McNally Irish Pub
cathash.Specialty drinks: Have a Gunness at McNally Irish Pub

title: George & Walt's
description: Comfortable dive bar with friendly bartenders serving reasonably priced drinks. There's an Internet jukebox, new-ish sound system, two pool tables, video games and about 20 flat screens. The lounge with the fireplace and big screen has its own home theater audio. Good hangout spot for groups of friends, within walking distance from Rockridge BART

cathash.Hang out: Drink a big boy and chill out at George & Walt's

title: Eddie's Drive In Liquors
description: Eddie's is no mere package store, it's a first-rate place to buy liquor and more. A bit of everything liquor-related, lots of interesting beers, good prices, good snacks, basic stuff like milk and eggs and even several kinds of top quality ice cream. Friendly service and an ATM with a very small surcharge if you need cash. The wall outside is great for shotgunning beers against, within walking distance from Rockridge BART

cathash.Hang out: Make a beer run to Eddie's Drive In Liquors
cathash.Berkeley Favorites: Shotgun a beer against Eddie's Drive In Liquors wall

title: Ye Old Hut
description: Unassuming, ancient, boiling hearth, billiard table, ping to the pong. There's even a jukebox here to jam away your evening with friends or a loved one. Bring cash because their ATM machine is pretty unreliable. Within walking distance from Rockridge BART

cathash.Hang out: Jam to a jukebox and play ping pong at Ye Old Hut

title: Ben & Nick's
description: With its killer pub menu and excellent selection of craft beers, Ben & Nick's is a great spot to grab a bite and a brew while still being close enough to a BART station--crawling distance to Rockridge BART--to be well-suited to an evening of chillaxing with friends.

cathash.Hang out: Savor a brew at Ben & Nick's Pub
cathash.Sit Down... Stay A While: Dine and drink at Ben & Nick's Pub

title: Henry's
description: At night, this place is a classier restaurant/bar, which there aren't very many of within walking distance of campus. Think the opposite of KIP's. Expect to run into professors, or your friends' parents visiting from out of town and staying at Hotel Durant here. The cocktails are good and decently priced (under $10). But on Cal football game days, Henry's is definitely the place to be (besides the game itself). This place opens up and there are lots of alumni standing around and watching the game. The back patio is also open. It can be mildly lively or awesomely crowded depending on which game you're watching. Get a Golden Bear ($9) - orange juice, southern comfort, amaretto, and a float of 151. Or get a Bloody Mary. Dangerously delicious.

cathash.Berkeley Favorites: Watch a Cal Football game at Henry's
cathash.Specialty drinks: Get a Bloody Mary at Henry's

title: Trumer Pils
description: What's an Austrian pilsner doing with a brewery in Berkeley? For one thing, keeping it fresh and local, while doing a stand-up job of preserving the original Trumer Pils process. Trumer makes just this one pilsner, but they do it right: crisp and clean, just a slight bitter aftertaste, bubbles like champagne. The staff and brewers are good people, of course very knowledgeable, but more importantly friendly and approachable about the brand, it's history and style. Highly recommend going on a tour, or for one of their special events.

cathash.Specialty drinks: Enjoy a locally brewed Austrian pilsner at Trumer Pils

title: McCone Hall Lounge
description: While you study, enjoy the view of the Bay from the lounge in McCone.

cathash.Study in absolute silence: Study with a great view at McCone Hall Lounge

title: Ishi Court at Dwinelle Hall
description: Finding a room in Dwinelle can be a confusing/scary mission, don't be ashamed to look at a map. There's a Peet's coffee in this building. Look at the flyers on the walls for student events.
address: University of California Berkeley Berkeley, CA 94704

cathash.Study in absolute silence: Grab a room to study in at Ishi Court at Dwinelle Hall

title: Schmidt's Pub
description: They have a great beer selection - try the stout that tastes like a "deconstructed s'more." Like the kind you used to enjoy around the campfire when you'd go camping with Dad every summer. It actually tastes like graham crackers, marshmallows and chocolate. Don't like beer? Drink wine! You can get cozy inside on the couches or spread out on the porch outside.

cathash.Hang out: Try out new beers at Schmidt's Pub
cathash.Specialty drinks: Try outrageously wacky beers at Schmidt's Pub

title: Club Mallard
description: Easy parking, good, cheap drinks, large interior, two outdoor seating seating areas, and pool tables. I think they even have snacks? This place is awesome. The lower level has a rustic log cabin-esque feel with a longer bar than upstairs. If you sit in front of the fireplace you'll be stared down by a gigantic stuffed buffalo head while you sip your poison and gossip with your pals. The upstairs area has yet another bar, some pool tables, and a tiki themed balcony with heat lamps. The clash of the rustic and the tiki oddly works extremely well, probably because it's hilarious. The hallway is covered with children's photos which is both creepy and adorable and mesmerizing when waiting in line for the bathroom.

cathash.Hang out: Watch sports, play pool and hang on Club Mallard's patio

title: The Albatross Pub
description: This is the type of bar that you can bring your friends who don't necessarily enjoy alcohol as much as you, and still have a great time. This place has a great bar selection...classic cocktails, some nice Scotches and Whiskeys, and some great pitcher specials. On top of the beers and drinks, this place has some great things to do at it! Into trivia? There's a night for that! Into darts? Plenty boards! Pool? No problem! Sports? There's a TV! Live music? The Bird has that too.

cathash.Hang out: Kick it with friends at The Albatross Pub
cathash.Specialty drinks: Classic cocktails, nice Scotches and Whiskeys, and some great pitcher specials at The Albatross Pub
cathash.Berkeley Favorites: Rock trivia night at The Albatross Pub

title: Filippo's
description: If you get the house wine (white or red), it's $7 for the bottle and they are good house bottles. You can't go wrong. The bread and olive oil is delicious as well, and they will continue to refill it throughout your service (which is really nice, especially if you love bread). This restaurant is a tad pricey but the food is worth it. Usually on a Friday and Saturday night they aren't too busy, and it gives a more intimate feeling.

title: Hotsy Totsy Club
description: This bar stands out in its gin selection. And they know how to make martinis. They don't skip on the vermouth but only use the right amount. They also have st. Germains elderflower liquor, great substitute for vermouth. There is a fantastic Mexican roach coach outside where they let you bring the food into the bar.

cathash.Hang out: Play pool, shuffleboard at the Hotsy Totsy Club
cathash.Specialty drinks: Try out a myriad of gins at the Hotsy Totsy Club

title: Au Coquelet Cafe Restaurant
description: This is THE place to go for late night studying. Cool indie spot to grab a cup of coffee and a bite to eat. The wireless is fantastic here (one of the few places on campus that actually has good internet). Plenty of outlets if needing a charge. Located in town, yet near campus/BART, it's close to what you need.

cathash.Study with some background noise: Study hard and late at Au Coquelet Cafe
cathash.Study Snacks: Grab coffee and grub at Au Coquelet Cafe
cathash.Quick But Good: Grab coffee and grub at Au Coquelet Cafe

title: Beer Revolution
description: Beer Revolution is never at a loss for variety for beers.  Whether it is on tap or out of a bottle, this place has every type of beer imaginable (or so it would seem).  It has a great outdoor area for socializing or you can drink inside at their tables that have been fashioned from wooden kegs. Protip:  find a seat, look at the assortment of beer choices on tap, and then come up with a first and second choice.  If you are ever in doubt, just ask the bar tender to try one of the options and they are more than happy to wet your beak with a tasting.

cathash.Specialty drinks: Try any beer imaginable at Beer Revolution
cathash.Hang out: Sip unique brews on Beer Revolution's patio
cathash.Berkeley Favorites: Try any beer imaginable at Beer Revolution

title: Strawberry Creek
description: Strawberry Creek has large pieces of green for sunbathing, for picnicking, and for running around with your dogs. For those of you who do not like the sun, the beautiful groves provide shade and screening from the traffic nearby. It is, after all, right in the middle of a residential neighborhood.

cathash.Walk it out: Take a walk around Strawberry Creek

title: Sather Tower
description: The Campanile provides amazing carrilon music throughout the day with its 61 bells, along with a great place to relax and soak in a breathtaking view of Berkeley and the bay.
address: South Hall Road, University of California Berkeley, Berkeley, CA 94720

cathash.Scenic Views: Enjoy a breathtaking view of Berkeley and the Bay at Sather Tower
cathash.Hangout spots: Hangout at Sather Tower and enjoy the view with your friends

title: Berkeley Rose Garden
description: This place is literally a sanctuary where roses come to thrive and people come to take their prom photos. Bring a picnic, sandwich, book, date, etc and you'll have a relaxing and magical experience. Despite it's "hippy" "bizzzerkly" reputation, Berkeley is full of little gems like this to remind us what beauty truly is.

cathash.Scenic Views: Smell the roses at the Berkeley Rose Garden
cathash.Hangout spots: Have a picnic or read a book at the Berkeley Rose Garden
cathash.Walk it out: Take a walk around the gorgeous Berkeley Rose Garden

title: Doe & Moffitt
description: Plenty of table space and most have outlets, during regular hours through most of the semester it's pretty easy to get a half table to yourself (two spots). Moffitt can get loud and cold, but Doe is usually pretty quiet.

cathash.Study in absolute silence: Grab a table to study at Doe & Moffitt

title: Albany Bulb
description: This park is so Berkeley. You've got your well-graffiti-ed stones on the lower trail.  You've got that grungy, cool, artsy feel with all that metal art and painting on the leftover debris of a former landfill (yes, Albany Bulb used to be a landfill).  And of course, you've got your carefree hippie and pedestrian population enjoying the million dollar view of the Bay and San Francisco. Great hikes and views.

cathash.Walk it out: Take a walk around the Albany Bulb
cathash.Scenic Views: See cool art and a view of the Bay at the Albany Bulb
cathash.Take a hike: Explore the outside art and views of the Albany Bulb

title: Thalassa
description: In greek, Thalassa means ocean and this place is definitely an ocean of fun! It's the place to hang out with friends, drink, and enjoy a round of pool. You can rent a pool table for 5$ an hour daily before 8PM.

cathash.Hang out: Play a round of pool at Thalassa
cathash.Berkeley Favorites: Play a round of pool at Thalassa

title: Kip's
description: Quintessential last night stop in Berkeley. Already drunk, having a good time. There's a dance floor that is either empty or super crowded.

cathash.Rage: Get your dance on at Kip's
cathash.Berkeley Favorites: End a great night of drinking by raging at Kip's

title: Triple Rock Brewery & Ale House
description: This is a nice dive bar/brewery that serves good beer and bar food. Every Thursday they have a drink called "Monkey Head" that is Berkeley-famous. They also have random board games and playing cards you can use. It's good old times here just chatting and drinking. It's simple. No bells and whistles (like loud annoying music)--just an honest brewery in Berkeley serving the people. It's in a good part of town near lots of POIs on Shattuck Ave.

cathash.Hang out: Play board and card games at Triple Rock Brewery & Ale House
cathash.Specialty drinks: Drink "Monkey Head" at Triple Rock Brewery & Ale House
cathash.Berkeley Favorites: Drink "Monkey Head" at Triple Rock Brewery & Ale House

title: Cafe Durant
description: A great place to go for Mexican food on Sat mornings before the Cal football game. Open early (7:30am), extensive breakfast and Mexican food menu, and most importantly, HDTV and free wifi, with plenty of electrical outlets to keep all your devices charged. The food itself is reasonably priced with large portions.  Plenty of beverages to choose from.  and this place is still a secret to out-of-towners, so none of their crazy fans to bother us.
categories: Brunch Time is All the Time

cathash.Brunch Time is All the Time: Devour Mexican style brunch food at Cafe Durant
cathash.Quick But Good: Grab a quick bite of Mexican at Cafe Durant

title: The Big C
description: Admittedly, the big C itself isn't much to look at. It's yellow, it's cracked, and there's bottles of alcohol littering the scene. However, the view that the Big C affords is breathtaking. You can see so much more of the bay than on top of the campanile and it's gorgeous at night. The hike is about 20 minutes long at a leisurely pace.

cathash.Take a hike: Hike to the top of The Big C and enjoy the killer view
cathash.Scenic Views: Enjoy the killer view at the top of The Big C
cathash.Walk it out: Walk to the top of The Big C and enjoy the killer view

title: Skate Park
description: This park has something for all skill levels. You don't need to push much because the roll-ins are in a great spot to carve lines. One side starts with some short mellow banks that get progressively steeper until head high transitions. A spine with a roll-over spot joins the bowl to the street course. The bowl also has a 9ft vert. If all of that is too much for you then skate around the track.

cathash.Sports: Pop a kickflip at the Berkeley Skate Park

title: Strawberry Canyon
description: Perfect place to while away a sunny day. There is a large, clean outdoor pool surrounded by the verdant hills of Strawberry Canyon.  Float in the water or swim on your back and admire the numerous shades of green and how they go so well with the deep violet blue of a clear spring sky.

cathash.Get wet: Go swimming at Strawberry Canyon's Pool
cathash.Hangout spots: Chill out with friends at Strawberry Canyon's pool

title: Mel-o-dee
description: Awesome karaoke selection. Awesome-er karaoke DJ. Nice little dance floor if the mood strikes. Comfortable seating. GREAT screen for onlookers and singers alike. Super-friendly bar staff. Decent drink prices. And the absolute coup - free hotdogs and fresh popcorn on Wednesday nights. I mean, seriously?!
address: 240 El Cerrito Plaza El Cerrito, California 94530

cathash.Hang out: Get your groove on at Mel-o-dee's karaoke bar
cathash.Berkeley Favorites: Sing your favorite song at Mel-o-dee's karaoke bar

title: Berkeley Hot Yoga
description: Yoga to the People is best known for their hot yoga, where they really turn up the heat. They have very professional and friendly instructors who are always willing to help new students, and keep a clean, smell-free hot yoga studio.

cathash.Yoga: Hot Yoga at Yoga to the People

title: Willard Park
description: Very quaint park nestled away from the busier streets of Berkeley. Many people come here with their dogs, friends, kids, guitars, and various activities. There's also a small playground and a couple tennis courts. Other popular activities include picnics, playing dodgeball/football/frisbee/soccer, throwing a boomerang, jamming on a guitar, or just laying in the grass reading a book.

title: VLSB: Marian Koshland Bioscience and Natural Resources Library
description: One of the favorite libraries on campus, VLCB features quiet study in cubicles and couches, science textbooks on reserve, and a handful of fossils (including a freakin t-rex).
address: 2101 Valley Life Sciences Bldg, Ste 6500, Berkeley, CA 94720

cathash.Study in absolute silence: Study in a cubicle at the Bioscience Library in VLSB

title: The Missouri Lounge
description: Molo is the place to go-go if you wanna dance to ghetto fab rap on Friday nights (although I wish they'd stick some Biggie, Warren G, Missy, and Pac in yo). The outdoor area is pretty cool but the drunkards tend to hog the tables. There's food and such and their Martini's are 7-9 bucks depending on the Vodka/Gin you use. If you're bored and wanna kick it with some locals, go here.

cathash.Rage: Dance to ghetto fab rap at The Missouri Lounge

title: Wonderland Books
description: Wonderland Books specializes in used, rare and also collectible books. Although it is a small store and has its bookshelves packed with books some of the overflow is stacked the floors it is reasonably neat. The books are well organized by categories and the owner is especially helpful to point you to a section you might be interested in. Parking is on the street but it is not hard to find a spot.

cathash.Only got $20 in my pocket: Browse used or collectible books at Wonderland Books

title: UC Berkeley Art Museum
description: All around awesome. Not too small to be boring and under-endowed, not too big to be lost or have that big museum attitude. They use their space wisely with excellent exhibits and choice of work. It is a must see. Also, the cafe is wonderful and relaxing as it is nestled inside the museums walls outside the noise and hubbub of the Berkeley campus/telegraph environment outside. Free for Cal students.

cathash.Museum: Delve into modern art at the Berkeley Art Museum

title: Berkeley Aquatic Park
description: One loop around the mirror-like lagoon is a little under three miles (rough estimate).  There are boat and bike rentals near the entrance of the park (Addison St.), as well as a cute waterside cafe. They also have a frisbee golf course.

cathash.Walk it out: Go for a brisk walk at the Aquatic Park
cathash.Sports: Frisbee golf at the Aquatic Park

title: Chez Pannise
description: Following a fire, Alice Waters' inspired gastronomic shrine in Berkeley is again welcoming acolytes who come for simple yet exquisite, seasonal Cal-Med prix fixes that let the ingredients shine (even their green garden salad is amazing), delivered with exemplary service; there are no new surprises on the menu and the unique Craftsman-style setting remains largely the same, so while the lack of choice might still miff a few, most locavores insist the place where it all started remains the gold standard. If you've got the dough, this is the prime dinner date spot around Berkeley.

cathash.Hot Date: Take your date to Chez Pannise

title: Lawrence Hall of Science
description: Situated up in the hills, the Lawrence Hall of Science houses a host of interesting science related exhibits. It's free to Cal students and is seriously worth checking out. It's also simple to get there, which means less hassle convincing your friends to spend their Sunday at a science museum.

cathash.Museum: Treat your left brain to the Lawrence Hall of Science
cathash.Scenic Views: Catch a dazzling view of the bay outside the Lawrence Hall of Science

description: Located on Berkeley’s campus, the Pacific Film Archive offers moviegoers an assortment of films from indie to anime and Hitchcock in a revolving exhibition. The archives also contain the largest collection of Japanese films outside Japan as well as over 10,000 videos.
title: Pacific Film Archive

cathash.Museum: Catch a kickback flick at the Pacific Film Archive

title: Museum of Vertebrate Zoology
description: Situated across from the giant Tyrannosaurus Rex skeleton in the Valley Life Science Building, the expansive Museum of Vertebrate Zoology boasts an enormous display of stuffed taxidermy, live animals (this year snakes, bats, and raptors) and an animal origami collection by paper master Bernie Peyton.

cathash.Museum: Get psyched up about having a backbone at the Museum of Vertebrate Zoology

address: 3101 Valley Life Sciences Building University of California Berkeley, CA 94720-3160

cathash.Museum: Discover how intense Bonsai can be at the Golden State Bonsai Collection

description: Located right next to Lake Merritt is the GSBF Collection, the largest Bonsai collection in all of Northern California, featuring a wide variety of over 250 trees. Curator Kathy Shaner is the only Japanese-certified bonsai master in the United States.
title: Golden State Bonsai Federation Collection North
address: Lakeside Garden Center Lake Merritt Oakland, CA 94620

title: Oakland Museum of California
description: The one-of-a-kind Oakland Museum of California is a natural history museum, art museum, and history museum all rolled up into one - each floor is dedicated to something different. If that's not enough for you, the outside garden is a reason alone to stop here! It consists of several levels of outdoor artwork, a lawn and picnic area on the bottom, and it has an incredible view of Lake Merritt. Best of all, the first Sunday of the month is free.
address: Get your socks knocked off at the awesome Oakland Museum of California
